intro: Fernandezia carabayana, commonly known as the Carabayana fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Fernandezia carabayana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous areas with rich soil. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
